item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The longer I live, the more uninformed I feel. Only the young have an explanation for everything." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Don't gobblefunk around with words." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Thomas Babington Macaulay
item.description: "What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!" -- Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A self is not something static, tied up in a pretty parcel and handed to the child, finished and complete. A self is always becoming." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Hard times require furious dancing. Each of us is proof." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by John Calvin
item.description: "We should ask God to increase our hope when it is small, awaken it when it is dormant, confirm it when it is wavering, strengthen it when it is weak, and raise it up when it is overthrown." -- John Calvin

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by John Calvin
item.description: "There is not one blade of grass, there is no color in this world that is not intended to make us rejoice." -- John Calvin

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn." -- Hal Borland

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "The conversation of kisses. Subtle, engrossing, fearless, transforming." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Karl Barth
item.description: "Theology is not a private subject for theologians only. Nor is it a private subject for professors. Fortunately, there have always been pastors who have understood more about theology than most professors. Nor is theology a private subject of study for pastors. Fortunately, there have repeatedly been congregation members, and often whole congregations, who have pursued theology energetically while their pastors were theological infants or barbarians. Theology is a matter for the Church." -- Karl Barth

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Dorothy Sayers
item.description: "[Sloth is] the sin which believes in nothing, cares for nothing, seeks to know nothing, interferes with nothing, enjoys nothing, loves nothing, hates nothing, finds purpose in nothing, lives for nothing, and only remains alive because there is nothing it would die for." -- Dorothy Sayers

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by W.S. Merwin
item.description: "Poetry is a way of looking at the world for the first time." -- W.S. Merwin

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Nancy Pearcey
item.description: "The Rosetta Stone of Christian social thought is the Trinity." -- Nancy Pearcey

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Kathleen Winsor
item.description: "Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful." -- Kathleen Winsor

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Emmanuel add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love – and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren
